pullRequest.body:
This PR completes the classification of finite Z-Groups (groups with cyclic Sylow subgroups, which includes all groups of squarefree order). The conclusion is that a finite group is a Z-group if and only if it is a semidirect product of two cyclic groups of coprime order.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20356~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20357~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20359~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20694~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

What do you think about the following alternate statement:
```lean
theorem isZGroup_iff_mulEquiv [Finite G] :
    IsZGroup G â†” âˆƒ (H N : Subgroup G) (Ï† : H â†’* MulAut N) (e : G â‰ƒ* N â‹Š[Ï†] H),
      IsCyclic H âˆ§ IsCyclic N âˆ§ (Nat.card H).Coprime (Nat.card N) := by
  sorry
```
Assuming I've got that right, I think this has the advantage that one can obtain actual subgroups rather than abstract cyclic groups. Of course with sufficient API for semidirect products this shouldn't matter too much but it might still be preferable.

> What do you think about the following alternate statement:
> 
> ```lean
> theorem isZGroup_iff_mulEquiv [Finite G] :
>     IsZGroup G â†” âˆƒ (H N : Subgroup G) (Ï† : H â†’* MulAut N) (e : G â‰ƒ* N â‹Š[Ï†] H),
>       IsCyclic H âˆ§ IsCyclic N âˆ§ (Nat.card H).Coprime (Nat.card N) := by
>   sorry
> ```
> 
> Assuming I've got that right, I think this has the advantage that one can obtain actual subgroups rather than abstract cyclic groups. Of course with sufficient API for semidirect products this shouldn't matter too much but it might still be preferable.

Done, although one quirk with the new statement is that it doesn't guarantee that the subgroups are complementary.

Excellent, thanks!

Regarding the lack of complementarity, this is a good point. It would indeed be desirable to have a stronger version which includes this. However I think that can come later, and I think the new version is still an improvement.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/SpecificGroups/Cyclic): Actions on cyclic groups factor through `ZMod`
